items.name: laptop
items.description: Your trusty development machine, loaded with VS Code, Docker, and all your favorite tools for Ruby, React, and Rust development.

items.name: coffee mug
items.description: A large mug with 'Keep Calm and Code On' printed on it. Essential for those long coding sessions.

items.name: rust crate
items.description: Your Nightrunner text adventure engine, written in Rust. This powers interactive fiction games and can be compiled to WebAssembly.

items.name: portfolio
items.description: Your online portfolio showcasing projects like Nightrunner Engine, Nightrunner Editor, and Puppeteer GIF Cast.

items.name: whiteboard
items.description: A whiteboard filled with diagrams explaining state management patterns in the Nightrunner Engine, demonstrating immutable state transitions.

items.name: bug report
items.description: A detailed bug report about an issue in the streaming solution you developed at Poll Everywhere.

items.name: documentation
items.description: Comprehensive documentation for the Nightrunner Engine, explaining how to use the WebAssembly exports effectively.

subjects.name: recruiter
subjects.description: A tech recruiter interested in your skills and experience with Ruby, React, and Rust.
subjects.default_text: The recruiter says: 'I'm impressed with your experience at Poll Everywhere and ServicePros. Can you tell me more about your work with Rust and WebAssembly?'

subjects.name: colleague
subjects.description: A fellow developer who's working with you on optimizing CI/CD pipelines.
subjects.default_text: Your colleague says: 'That state management pattern you implemented in the Nightrunner Engine is brilliant. The immutable state transitions make time-travel debugging so much easier.'

subjects.name: browser
subjects.description: A web browser window showing your Nightrunner library compiled to WebAssembly.
subjects.default_text: The browser is running your WebAssembly module smoothly, with the console showing no errors.

narratives.text: You're in your home office, surrounded by the tools of your trade. Your {laptop} sits on the desk, ready for another day of coding. On the wall is a {whiteboard} with architectural diagrams. Your {portfolio} website is open on a second monitor. Your {coffee mug} is nearby, half-full and still warm.

This is your development workspace, where you build the Nightrunner Engine. Multiple terminal windows are open, and the code for your {rust crate} is visible. A {browser} window shows the WebAssembly output being tested. Your detailed {documentation} is open in another window.

You're in a virtual meeting space. Your {laptop} is connected to a video call. A {recruiter} has joined the call to discuss potential opportunities. You have your {portfolio} open, ready to showcase your work.

This is the debugging zone. Your {laptop} shows multiple files open as you track down a tricky issue described in a {bug report}. Your {colleague} is looking over your shoulder, ready to help brainstorm a solution.

You're at a desk in your virtual office. Your work on streaming solutions using Playwright, FFmpeg, and Go is displayed on your {laptop}. Your {coffee mug} sits nearby, keeping you fueled for complex problem-solving.

events.name: Discuss experience
events.description: Discuss your work experience with recruiter

intro: Welcome to 'A Day in the Life of Aimeri'! In this text adventure, you'll experience the professional world of Aimeri Baddouh, a Senior Software Engineer with expertise in DevOps, full-stack development, and Rust programming. Navigate through different work environments, interact with technologies, and discover the projects that showcase Aimeri's skills. Type 'help' for available commands, and begin your journey in Aimeri's home office.

room_blueprints.name: Development Workspace
room_blueprints.description: Where you build the Nightrunner Engine
